isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Adjustments - Inspection Before Alignment

svcprocinfo.para: Check the following before doing a front wheel alignment.

svcsubproc.title: Inspection
svcsubproc.para: Refer to LUBRICATION, INSPECTION AND MAINTENANCE Section in this manual.

item.para: Verify that the tires are inflated to the specified pressure.
Verify that the front tires are the same size and type.
Verify that the lug nuts are tightened to the specified torque.
Verify that the wheels are balanced.
Check for bent or damaged wheels.
Verify that all fasteners are tightened to the specified torque.
Inspect the leaf springs for wear and damage.
Inspect the shock absorbers for wear and damage.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Axle and Rear Suspension
svcsubproc.para: Front tire wear can be caused by the rear axle. If the outer edge of one front tire is worn and the inner edge of the other front tire is worn, check the following:

item.para: Verify that all fasteners are tightened to the specified torque.
Verify that the leaf springs are not worn or damaged.
Verify that the bushings in the leaf springs are not worn or damaged.
Verify that the torque rods (if used) are correctly adjusted.
Verify that the frame is not bent.
Verify that the rear axle (especially a tandem axle) is correctly aligned. Refer to the procedure of the manufacturer of the vehicle or the suspension.
Refer to any additional rear axle and suspension recommendations and specifications from the vehicle manufacturer.
